trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Store app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Store app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services] or <link><linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services] or <link><linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to authenticate users in Windows Store and Windows Phone Store 8.1 apps.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to authenticate users in Windows Store and Windows Phone Store 8.1 apps.

trans-unit.source: For a Windows Phone 8.0 or Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 app, see this version of <link><linkText>Get started with authentication in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a Windows Phone 8.0 or Windows Phone Silverlight 8.1 app, see this version of <link><linkText>Get started with authentication in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates a service-managed authentication flow using a variety of identity providers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates a service-managed authentication flow using a variety of identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.
trans-unit.target: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.

trans-unit.source: To instead use a client-managed flow using Live SDK in your Windows Store app, see the topic <link><linkText>Authenticate your Windows Store app with client managed authentication using Microsoft account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To instead use a client-managed flow using Live SDK in your Windows Store app, see the topic <link><linkText>Authenticate your Windows Store app with client managed authentication using Microsoft account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: When you use Visual Studio tools to connect your app to a Mobile Service, the tool generate two sets of MobileServiceClient definitions, one for each client platform.
trans-unit.target: When you use Visual Studio tools to connect your app to a Mobile Service, the tool generate two sets of MobileServiceClient definitions, one for each client platform.

trans-unit.source: This is a good time to simplify the generated code by unifying the #if...#endif wrapped MobileServiceClient definitions into a single unwrapped definition used by both versions of the app.
trans-unit.target: This is a good time to simplify the generated code by unifying the #if...#endif wrapped MobileServiceClient definitions into a single unwrapped definition used by both versions of the app.

trans-unit.source: You won't need to do this if you downloaded the quickstart app from the Azure Management portal.
trans-unit.target: You won't need to do this if you downloaded the quickstart app from the Azure Management portal.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Now, any user authenticated by your trusted identity providers can access the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Now, any user authenticated by your trusted identity providers can access the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: To better secure user-specific data, you must also implement authorization.
trans-unit.target: To better secure user-specific data, you must also implement authorization.

trans-unit.source: To do this you get the user ID of a given user, which can then be used to determine what level of access that user should have for a given resource.
trans-unit.target: To do this you get the user ID of a given user, which can then be used to determine what level of access that user should have for a given resource.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Store the authorization token on the client
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Store the authorization token on the client

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, <link><linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users</linkText><title></title></link>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, <link><linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users</linkText><title></title></link>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Enhanced users feature</linkText><title></title></link><html></html>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Enhanced users feature</linkText><title></title></link><html></html>

trans-unit.source: You can get additional user data maintained by the identity provider in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can get additional user data maintained by the identity provider in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: [Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]<html></html>Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with a .NET client.
trans-unit.target: [Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]<html></html>Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with a .NET client.
